125 constexpr int MAX_CLAIRVOYANCE = 40;
126 // kcal in a kilogram of fat, used to convert stored kcal into body weight. 3500kcal/lb * 2.20462lb/kg = 7716.17
127 constexpr float KCAL_PER_KG = 3500 * 2.20462;

129 /// @brief type of conditions that effect vision
130 /// @note vision modes do not necessarily match json ids or flags
131 enum vision_modes {
132  DEBUG_NIGHTVISION,
133  NV_GOGGLES,
134  NIGHTVISION_1,
135  NIGHTVISION_2,
136  NIGHTVISION_3,
137  FULL_ELFA_VISION,
138  ELFA_VISION,
139  CEPH_VISION,
140  /// mutate w/ id "FEL_NV" & name "Feline Vision" see pretty well at night
141  FELINE_VISION,
142  /// Bird mutation named "Avian Eyes": Perception +4
143  BIRD_EYE,
144  /// mutate w/ id "URSINE_EYE" & name "Ursine Vision" see better in dark, nearsight in light
145  URSINE_VISION,
146  BOOMERED,
147  DARKNESS,
148  IR_VISION,
149  VISION_CLAIRVOYANCE,
150  VISION_CLAIRVOYANCE_PLUS,
151  VISION_CLAIRVOYANCE_SUPER,
152  NUM_VISION_MODES
153 };

155 enum class sleepiness_levels : int {
156  TIRED = 191,
157  DEAD_TIRED = 383,
158  EXHAUSTED = 575,
159  MASSIVE_SLEEPINESS = 1000
160 };
161 const std::unordered_map<std::string, sleepiness_levels> sleepiness_level_strs = { {
162  { "TIRED", sleepiness_levels::TIRED },
163  { "DEAD_TIRED", sleepiness_levels::DEAD_TIRED },
164  { "EXHAUSTED", sleepiness_levels::EXHAUSTED },
165  { "MASSIVE_SLEEPINESS", sleepiness_levels::MASSIVE_SLEEPINESS }
166  }
167 };
168 
169 constexpr inline bool operator>=( const sleepiness_levels &lhs, const sleepiness_levels &rhs )
170 {
171  return static_cast<int>( lhs ) >= static_cast<int>( rhs );
172 }
173 
174 constexpr inline bool operator<( const sleepiness_levels &lhs, const sleepiness_levels &rhs )
175 {
176  return static_cast<int>( lhs ) < static_cast<int>( rhs );
177 }
178 
179 template<typename T>
180 constexpr inline bool operator>=( const T &lhs, const sleepiness_levels &rhs )
181 {
182  return lhs >= static_cast<T>( rhs );
183 }
184 
185 template<typename T>
186 constexpr inline bool operator>( const T &lhs, const sleepiness_levels &rhs )
187 {
188  return lhs > static_cast<T>( rhs );
189 }
190 
191 template<typename T>
192 constexpr inline bool operator<=( const T &lhs, const sleepiness_levels &rhs )
193 {
194  return lhs <= static_cast<T>( rhs );
195 }
196 
197 template<typename T>
198 constexpr inline bool operator<( const T &lhs, const sleepiness_levels &rhs )
199 {
200  return lhs < static_cast<T>( rhs );
201 }
202 
203 template<typename T>
204 constexpr inline int operator/( const sleepiness_levels &lhs, const T &rhs )
205 {
206  return static_cast<T>( lhs ) / rhs;
207 }
208 
209 template<typename T>
210 constexpr inline int operator+( const sleepiness_levels &lhs, const T &rhs )
211 {
212  return static_cast<T>( lhs ) + rhs;
213 }
214 
215 template<typename T>
216 constexpr inline int operator-( const sleepiness_levels &lhs, const T &rhs )
217 {
218  return static_cast<T>( lhs ) - rhs;
219 }
220 
221 template<typename T>
222 constexpr inline int operator-( const T &lhs, const sleepiness_levels &rhs )
223 {
224  return lhs - static_cast<T>( rhs );
225 }
226 
227 /** @brief five levels of consequences for days without sleep
228  @details Sleep deprivation, distinct from sleepiness, is defined in minutes. Although most
229  calculations scale linearly, malus is bestowed only upon reaching the tiers defined below.
230  @note Sleep deprivation increases sleepiness. Sleepiness increase scales with the severity of sleep
231  deprivation.
232  @note Sleep deprivation kicks in if lack of sleep is avoided with stimulants or otherwise for
233  long periods of time
234  @see https://github.com/CleverRaven/Cataclysm-DDA/blob/master/src/character.cpp#L5566
235 */
236 enum sleep_deprivation_levels {
237  /// 2 days
238  SLEEP_DEPRIVATION_HARMLESS = 2 * 24 * 60,
239  /// 4 days
240  SLEEP_DEPRIVATION_MINOR = 4 * 24 * 60,
241  /// 7 days
242  SLEEP_DEPRIVATION_SERIOUS = 7 * 24 * 60,
243  /// 10 days
244  SLEEP_DEPRIVATION_MAJOR = 10 * 24 * 60,
245  /// 14 days
246  SLEEP_DEPRIVATION_MASSIVE = 14 * 24 * 60
247 };
248 
249 enum class blood_type {
250  blood_O,
251  blood_A,
252  blood_B,
253  blood_AB,
254  num_bt
255 };
256 
257 template<>
258 struct enum_traits<blood_type> {
259  static constexpr blood_type last = blood_type::num_bt;
260 };
261 
262 /// @brief how digestible or palatable an item is
263 /// @details This tries to represent both rating and character's decision to respect said rating
264 /// (ie "they can eat it, though they are disgusted by it")
265 enum edible_rating {
266  /// Edible or we pretend it is
267  EDIBLE,
268  /// Not food at all
269  INEDIBLE,
270  /// Not food because character has mutated mouth/system
271  INEDIBLE_MUTATION,
272  /// You can eat it, but it will hurt morale because of negative trait such as Hates Fruit
273  ALLERGY,
274  /// Smaller allergy penalty
275  ALLERGY_WEAK,
276  /// Penalty for eating human flesh (unless psycho/cannibal)
277  CANNIBALISM,
278  /// Comestible has parasites
279  PARASITES,
280  /// Rotten (or, for saprophages, not rotten enough)
281  ROTTEN,
282  /// Can provoke vomiting if you already feel nauseous.
283  NAUSEA,
284  /// We can eat this, but we'll suffer from overeat
285  TOO_FULL,
286  /// Some weird stuff that requires a tool we don't have
287  NO_TOOL
288 };
289 
290 enum crush_tool_type {
291  CRUSH_EMPTY_HANDS,
292  CRUSH_HAMMER,
293  CRUSH_DRILL_OR_HAMMER_AND_SCREW,
294  CRUSH_NO_TOOL
295 };
296 
297 struct queued_eoc {
298  public:
299  effect_on_condition_id eoc;
300  time_point time;
301  std::unordered_map<std::string, std::string> context;
302 };
303 
304 struct eoc_compare {
305  bool operator()( const queued_eoc &lhs, const queued_eoc &rhs ) const {
306  return lhs.time > rhs.time;
307  }
308 };
309 
310 struct queued_eocs {
311  using storage_iter = std::list<queued_eoc>::iterator;
312 
313  struct eoc_compare : ::eoc_compare {
314  bool operator()( const storage_iter &lhs, const storage_iter &rhs ) const {
315  return ::eoc_compare::operator()( *lhs, *rhs );
316  }
317  };
318  std::priority_queue<storage_iter, std::vector<storage_iter>, eoc_compare> queue;
319  std::list<queued_eoc> list;
320 
321  queued_eocs() = default;
322 
323  queued_eocs( const queued_eocs &rhs ) {
324  list = rhs.list;
325  for( auto it = list.begin(), end = list.end(); it != end; ++it ) {
326  queue.emplace( it );
327  }
328  };
329  queued_eocs( queued_eocs &&rhs ) noexcept {
330  queue.swap( rhs.queue );
331  list.swap( rhs.list );
332  }
333 
334  queued_eocs &operator=( const queued_eocs &rhs ) {
335  list = rhs.list;
336  // Why doesn't std::priority_queue have a clear() function.
337  queue = {};
338  for( auto it = list.begin(), end = list.end(); it != end; ++it ) {
339  queue.emplace( it );
340  }
341  return *this;
342  }
343  queued_eocs &operator=( queued_eocs &&rhs ) noexcept {
344  queue.swap( rhs.queue );
345  list.swap( rhs.list );
346  return *this;
347  }
348 
349  /* std::priority_queue compatibility layer where performance is less relevant */
350 
351  bool empty() const {
352  return queue.empty();
353  }
354 
355  const queued_eoc &top() const {
356  return *queue.top();
357  }
358 
359  void push( const queued_eoc &eoc ) {
360  auto it = list.emplace( list.end(), eoc );
361  queue.push( it );
362  }
363 
364  void pop() {
365  auto it = queue.top();
366  queue.pop();
367  list.erase( it );
368  }
369 };
370 
371 struct aim_type {
372  std::string name;
373  std::string action;
374  std::string help;
375  bool has_threshold;
376  int threshold;
377  bool operator==( const aim_type &other ) const {
378  return has_threshold == other.has_threshold &&
379  threshold == other.threshold &&
380  name == other.name &&
381  action == other.action &&
382  help == other.help;
383  }
384 };
385

387  int parallax_with_zoom;
388  int parallax_without_zoom;
389 };
390

399 };

406 struct consumption_event {
407  time_point time;
408  itype_id type_id;
409  uint64_t component_hash;
410 
411  consumption_event() = default;
412  explicit consumption_event( const item &food ) : time( calendar::turn ) {
413  type_id = food.typeId();
414  component_hash = food.make_component_hash();
415  }
416  void serialize( JsonOut &json ) const;
417  void deserialize( const JsonObject &jo );
418 };

423  int intelligence = 0;
424  int perception = 0;
425 
426  int speed = 0;
427 };
428 
429 inline social_modifiers operator+( social_modifiers lhs, const social_modifiers &rhs )
430 {
431  lhs += rhs;
432  return lhs;
433 }

435 /// @brief Four ability stats available on character creation
436 /// @details Default is 8. Minimum value is 4 and 14 is considered to be max human value.
437 enum class character_stat : char {
438  STRENGTH,
439  DEXTERITY,
440  INTELLIGENCE,
441  PERCEPTION,
442  DUMMY_STAT
443 };

448  HAIR_F, // customize facial hair
449  SKIN // customize skin color

452 enum class book_mastery {
453  CANT_DETERMINE, // book not yet identified, so you don't know yet
454  CANT_UNDERSTAND, // does not have enough skill to read
455  LEARNING,
456  MASTERED // can no longer increase skill by reading
457 };

459 enum class read_condition_result {
460  SUCCESS = 0,
461  NOT_BOOK = 1 << 0,
462  CANT_UNDERSTAND = 1 << 1,
463  MASTERED = 1 << 2,
464  DRIVING = 1 << 3,
465  ILLITERATE = 1 << 4,
466  NEED_GLASSES = 1 << 5,
467  TOO_DARK = 1 << 6,
468  MORALE_LOW = 1 << 7,
469  BLIND = 1 << 8
470 };
471

475 };

477 /** @relates ret_val */
478 template<>
479 struct ret_val<edible_rating>::default_success : public
480  std::integral_constant<edible_rating, EDIBLE> {};
481 
482 /** @relates ret_val */
483 template<>
484 struct ret_val<edible_rating>::default_failure : public
485  std::integral_constant<edible_rating, INEDIBLE> {};
486 
487 /** @relates ret_val */
488 template<>
489 struct ret_val<crush_tool_type>::default_success : public
490  std::integral_constant<crush_tool_type, CRUSH_EMPTY_HANDS> {};
491 
492 /** @relates ret_val */
493 template<>
494 struct ret_val<crush_tool_type>::default_failure : public
495  std::integral_constant<crush_tool_type, CRUSH_NO_TOOL> {};

522 class Character : public Creature, public visitable
523 {
524  public:
525  Character( const Character & ) = delete;
526  Character &operator=( const Character & ) = delete;
527  ~Character() override;
528 
529  // initialize avatar and avatar mocks
530  void initialize( bool learn_recipes = true );
531 
532  Character *as_character() override {
533  return this;
534  }
535  const Character *as_character() const override {
536  return this;
537  }
538  bool is_npc() const override {
539  return false; // Overloaded for NPCs in npc.h
540  }
541  // populate variables, inventory items, and misc from json object
542  virtual void deserialize( const JsonObject &jsobj ) = 0;
543 
544  // by default save all contained info
545  virtual void serialize( JsonOut &jsout ) const = 0;
546 
547  character_id getID() const;
548  /// sets the ID, will *only* succeed when the current id is not valid
549  /// allows forcing a -1 id which is required for templates to not throw errors
550  void setID( character_id i, bool force = false );
551 
552  field_type_id bloodType() const override;
553  field_type_id gibType() const override;
554  bool is_warm() const override;
555  bool in_species( const species_id &spec ) const override;
556  /// Turned to false for simulating NPCs on distant missions so they don't drop all their gear in sight
557  bool death_drops;
558  /// Is currently in control of a vehicle
559  bool controlling_vehicle = false;
560 
561  enum class comfort_level : int {
562  impossible = -999,
563  uncomfortable = -7,
564  neutral = 0,
565  slightly_comfortable = 3,
566  comfortable = 5,
567  very_comfortable = 10
568  };
569 
570  /// @brief Character stats
571  /// @todo Make those protected
572  int str_max;
573  int dex_max;
574  int int_max;
575  int per_max;
576 
577  int str_cur;
578  int dex_cur;
579  int int_cur;
580  int per_cur;
581 
582  int kill_xp = 0;
583  // Level-up points spent on Stats through Kills
584  int spent_upgrade_points = 0;
585 
586  float cached_organic_size;
587 
588  const profession *prof;
589  std::set<const profession *> hobbies;
590 
591  // Relative direction of a grab, add to posx, posy to get the coordinates of the grabbed thing.
592  tripoint grab_point;
593 
594  std::optional<city> starting_city;
595  std::optional<point_abs_om> world_origin;
596  bool random_start_location = true;
597  start_location_id start_location;
598 
599  bool manual_examine = false;
600  int volume = 0;
601  // The prevalence of getter, setter, and mutator functions here is partially
602  // a result of the slow, piece-wise migration of the player class upwards into
603  // the character class. As enough logic is moved upwards to fully separate
604  // utility upwards out of the player class, as many of these as possible should
605  // be eliminated to allow for proper code separation. (Note: Not "all", many").
606  /** Getters for stats exclusive to characters */
607  int get_str() const;
608  int get_dex() const;
609  int get_per() const;
610  int get_int() const;
611 
612  int get_str_base() const;
613  int get_dex_base() const;
614  int get_per_base() const;
615  int get_int_base() const;
616 
617  int get_str_bonus() const;
618  int get_dex_bonus() const;
619  int get_per_bonus() const;
620  int get_int_bonus() const;
621 
622  /** Cache variables to store stamina use info
623  * these will be updated when the player's limb makeup changes
624  * _power_use is how many joules to spend per stamina instead of stamina (default 0)
625  * _stam_mult is how much to multiply the incoming stamina cost's stamina drain (default of 1)
626  */
627  int arms_power_use; // millijoules
628  int legs_power_use; // millijoules
629  float arms_stam_mult;
630  float legs_stam_mult;
631  /** Getters for above stats */
632  int get_arms_power_use() const;
633  int get_legs_power_use() const;
634  float get_arms_stam_mult() const;
635  float get_legs_stam_mult() const;
636 
637  private:
638  /** Modifiers to character speed, with descriptions */
639  std::vector<speed_bonus_effect> speed_bonus_effects;
640 
641  int dodges_left;
642 
643  public:
644  std::vector<speed_bonus_effect> get_speed_bonus_effects() const;
645  int get_speed() const override;
646  int get_enchantment_speed_bonus() const;
647  // Strength modified by limb lifting score
648  int get_arm_str() const;
649  // Defines distance from which CAMOUFLAGE mobs are visible
650  int get_eff_per() const override;
651 
652  // Penalty modifiers applied for ranged attacks due to low stats
653  int ranged_dex_mod() const;
654  int ranged_per_mod() const;
655 
656  /** Setters for stats exclusive to characters */
657  void set_str_bonus( int nstr );
658  void set_dex_bonus( int ndex );
659  void set_per_bonus( int nper );
660  void set_int_bonus( int nint );
661  void mod_str_bonus( int nstr );
662  void mod_dex_bonus( int ndex );
663  void mod_per_bonus( int nper );
664  void mod_int_bonus( int nint );
665 
666  /** Setters for stats shared with other creatures */
667  using Creature::mod_speed_bonus;
668  void mod_speed_bonus( int nspeed, const std::string &desc );
669 
670  /** Getters for health values exclusive to characters */
671  int get_lifestyle() const;
672  int get_daily_health() const;
673  int get_health_tally() const;
674 
675  /** Modifiers for health values exclusive to characters */
676  void mod_livestyle( int nhealthy );
677  void mod_daily_health( int nhealthy_mod, int cap );
678  void mod_health_tally( int mod );
679 
680  /** Setters for health values exclusive to characters */
681  void set_lifestyle( int nhealthy );
682  void set_daily_health( int nhealthy_mod );
683 
684  /** Getter for need values exclusive to characters */
685  int get_stored_kcal() const;
686  int get_healthy_kcal() const;
687  // Returns stored kcals as a proportion of "healthy" kcals (1.0 == healthy)
688  float get_kcal_percent() const;
689  int kcal_speed_penalty() const;
690  int get_hunger() const;
691  int get_starvation() const;
692  virtual int get_thirst() const;
693  virtual int get_instant_thirst() const;
694 
695  time_duration get_daily_sleep() const;
696  void mod_daily_sleep( time_duration mod );
697  void reset_daily_sleep();
698  time_duration get_continuous_sleep() const;
699  void mod_continuous_sleep( time_duration mod );
700  void reset_continuous_sleep();
701 
702  int get_sleepiness() const;
703  int get_sleep_deprivation() const;
704 
705  /** Modifiers for need values exclusive to characters */
706  void mod_stored_kcal( int nkcal, bool ignore_weariness = false );
707  void mod_hunger( int nhunger );
708  void mod_thirst( int nthirst );
709  void mod_sleepiness( int nsleepiness );
710  void mod_sleep_deprivation( int nsleep_deprivation );
711 
712  /** Setters for need values exclusive to characters */
713  void set_stored_kcal( int kcal );
714  void set_hunger( int nhunger );
715  void set_thirst( int nthirst );
716  void set_sleepiness( int nsleepiness );
717  void set_sleepiness( sleepiness_levels nsleepiness );
718  void set_sleep_deprivation( int nsleep_deprivation );

720  protected:

874  /**

940  void calc_sleep_recovery_rate( needs_rates &rates ) const;

954  struct comfort_response_t {

956  const item *aid = nullptr;
957  };

959  comfort_response_t base_comfort_value( const tripoint_bub_ms &p ) const;

1043  int footstep_sound() const;

1045  int clatter_sound() const;

1047  void make_clatter_sound() const;
1048 
1049  bool can_switch_to( const move_mode_id &mode ) const;
1050  steed_type get_steed_type() const;
1051  virtual void set_movement_mode( const move_mode_id &mode ) = 0;
1052 
1053  /**
1054  * Generates an integer based on how many times we've gained non-negative mutations.
1055  * This is asked for any given tree, but counts all of our mutations in total.
1056  * Different than mutation_category_level[] in many ways:
1057  * - Does not count base traits, even if those are mutable, whereas mutation_category_level[] does.
1058  * - Does not count negative mutations, whereas mutation_category_level[] does.
1059  * - Assigns 1 point to each level of mutation in our category, and 2 for each level out of it.
1060  * - Individually counts each step of a multi level mutation (it counts Strong *and* Very Strong as their own mutations).
1061  * - mutation_category_level[] ignores Strong and counts Very Strong as slightly more than 1 mutation, but not 2 mutations.
1062  * - Meanwhile this counts Very Strong as 2 mutations, since you had to mutate Strong and then mutate that into Very Strong.
1063  * - This is to mimic the behavior of the old instability vitamin, which increased by 100 each time you mutated (so Very Strong was 200 instability).
1064  * The final result is used to calculate our current instability (influences chance of a negative mutation)
1065  * so each mutation we have that belongs to a different tree than the one we specified counts double.
1066  * Example: you start with Trog and mutate Slimy and Night Vision. Within Trog you have 2 points.
1067  * You then go to mutate Rat. Rat has Night Vision but not Slimy, so you have 1+2=3 points.
1068  * Having the Robust Genetics trait lets you "negate" this penalty, and makes all traits worth just 1 instability whether in/out of tree.
1069  */
1070  int get_instability_per_category( const mutation_category_id &categ ) const;
1071 
1072  /**Determine if character is susceptible to dis_type and if so apply the symptoms*/
1073  void expose_to_disease( const diseasetype_id &dis_type );
1074  /**
1075  * Handles end-of-turn processing.
1076  */
1077  void process_turn() override;
1078 
1079  /** Recalculates HP after a change to max strength or enchantment */
1080  void recalc_hp();
1081 
1082  /** Maintains body wetness and handles the rate at which the player dries */
1083  void update_body_wetness( const w_point &weather );
1084 
1085  /** Modifies the player's sight values
1086  * Must be called when any of the following change:
1087  * This must be called when any of the following change:
1088  * - effects
1089  * - bionics
1090  * - traits
1091  * - underwater
1092  * - clothes
1093  */
1094  void recalc_sight_limits();
1095  /**
1096  * Returns the apparent light level at which the player can see.
1097  * This is adjusted by the light level at the *character's* position
1098  * to simulate glare, etc, night vision only works if you are in the dark.
1099  */
1100  float get_vision_threshold( float light_level ) const;

1103  */
1104  void flag_encumbrance();

1109  void check_item_encumbrance_flag();

1221  void calc_all_parts_hp( float hp_mod = 0.0, float hp_adjust = 0.0, int str_max = 0,
1222  int dex_max = 0, int per_max = 0, int int_max = 0, int healthy_mod = 0,
1223  int fat_to_max_hp = 0 );
1224 
1225  /** Returns true if the player has stealthy movement */
1226  bool is_stealthy() const;
1227  /** Returns true if the current martial art works with the player's current weapon */
1228  bool can_melee() const;
1229  /** Returns value of player's stable footing */
1230  float stability_roll() const override;
1231  /** Returns true if the player can learn the entered martial art */
1232  bool can_autolearn( const matype_id &ma_id ) const;
1233  private:
1234  /** Check if an area-of-effect technique has valid targets */
1235  bool valid_aoe_technique( Creature &t, const ma_technique &technique );
1236  bool valid_aoe_technique( Creature &t, const ma_technique &technique,
1237  std::vector<Creature *> &targets );
1238  public:

1241  bool practice( const skill_id &id, int amount, int cap = 99, bool suppress_warning = false );

1243  void handle_skill_warning( const skill_id &id, bool force_warning = false );

1260  std::string weapname_ammo() const;

1271  bool bypass_med = false ) override;

1274  const damage_instance &d,
1275  const weakpoint_attack &attack = weakpoint_attack() ) override;

1278 
1279  void cough( bool harmful = false, int loudness = 4 );
1280  /**
1281  * Check for relevant passive, non-clothing that can absorb damage, and reduce by specified
1282  * damage unit. Only flat bonuses are checked here. Multiplicative ones are checked in
1283  * @ref player::absorb_hit. The damage amount will never be reduced to less than 0.
1284  * This is called from @ref player::absorb_hit
1285  */
1286  void passive_absorb_hit( const bodypart_id &bp, damage_unit &du ) const;
1287  /** Runs through all bionics and armor on a part and reduces damage through their armor_absorb */
1288  const weakpoint *absorb_hit( const weakpoint_attack &attack, const bodypart_id &bp,
1289  damage_instance &dam ) override;

1292  limb_score_id limb_score_1, limb_score_id limb_score_2 ) const;

1295  float melee_weakpoint_skill( const item &weapon ) const;
1296  float ranged_weakpoint_skill( const item &weapon ) const;
1297  float throw_weakpoint_skill() const;
1298  /**
1299  * Reduces and mutates du, prints messages about armor taking damage.
1300  * Requires a roll out of 100
1301  * @return true if the armor was completely destroyed (and the item must be deleted).
1302  */
1303  bool armor_absorb( damage_unit &du, item &armor, const bodypart_id &bp, int roll ) const;
1304  /**
1305  * Reduces and mutates du, prints messages about armor taking damage.
1306  * Requires a roll out of 100
1307  * @return true if the armor was completely destroyed (and the item must be deleted).
1308  */
1309  bool armor_absorb( damage_unit &du, item &armor, const bodypart_id &bp, const sub_bodypart_id &sbp,
1310  int roll ) const;
1311  /**
1312  * Reduces and mutates du, prints messages about armor taking damage.
1313  * If the armor is fully destroyed it is replaced
1314  * @return true if the armor was completely destroyed.
1315  */
1316  bool ablative_armor_absorb( damage_unit &du, item &armor, const sub_bodypart_id &bp, int roll );

1318  void describe_damage( damage_unit &du, item &armor ) const;

1321  * This is called from player::passive_absorb_hit
1322  */

1336  // In mutation.cpp
1337  /** Returns true if the player has a conflicting trait to the entered trait
1338  * Uses has_opposite_trait(), has_lower_trait(), and has_higher_trait() to determine conflicts.
1339  */
1340  bool has_conflicting_trait( const trait_id &flag ) const;
1341  /** Returns all player's traits conflicting with the entered trait */
1342  std::unordered_set<trait_id> get_conflicting_traits( const trait_id &flag ) const;
1343  /** Returns true if the player has a trait which upgrades into the entered trait */
1344  bool has_lower_trait( const trait_id &flag ) const;
1345  /** Returns player's traits which upgrade into the entered trait */
1346  std::unordered_set<trait_id> get_lower_traits( const trait_id &flag ) const;
1347  /** Returns true if the player has a trait which is a replacement of the entered trait */
1348  bool has_replacement_trait( const trait_id &flag ) const;
1349  /** Returns player's traits which replace the entered trait */
1350  std::unordered_set<trait_id> get_replacement_traits( const trait_id &flag ) const;
1351  /** Returns true if the player has a trait which adds to the entered trait */
1352  bool has_addition_trait( const trait_id &flag ) const;
1353  /** Returns player's traits which add to the entered trait */
1354  std::unordered_set<trait_id> get_addition_traits( const trait_id &flag ) const;
1355  /** Returns true if the player has a trait that shares a type with the entered trait */
1356  bool has_same_type_trait( const trait_id &flag ) const;
1357  /** Returns player's traits that share a type with the entered trait */
1358  std::unordered_set<trait_id> get_same_type_traits( const trait_id &flag ) const;
1359  /** Returns true if the entered trait may be purified away
1360  * Defaults to true
1361  */
1362  bool purifiable( const trait_id &flag ) const;

1382  int count_bodypart_with_flag( const json_character_flag &flag ) const;
1383  /** This is to prevent clang complaining about overloading a virtual function, the creature version uses monster flags so confusion is unlikely. */
1384  using Creature::has_flag;

1503  /**

1505  * Returns selected part.

1507  * show_all - show and enable choice of all limbs, not only healable
1508  * precise - show numerical hp

1510  * head_bonus - heal head
1511  * torso_bonus - heal torso
1512  * bleed - chance to stop bleeding
1513  * bite - chance to remove bite
1514  * infect - chance to remove infection
1515  * bandage_power - quality of bandage
1516  * disinfectant_power - quality of disinfectant
1517  */

1670  // --------------- Bionic Stuff ---------------
1671  /** Handles bionic activation effects of the entered bionic, returns if anything activated */
1672  bool activate_bionic( bionic &bio, bool eff_only = false, bool *close_bionics_ui = nullptr );
1673  std::vector<bionic_id> get_bionics() const;
1674  std::vector<const item *> get_pseudo_items() const;
1675  void invalidate_pseudo_items();
1676  /** Finds the highest UID for installed bionics and caches the next valid UID **/
1677  void update_last_bionic_uid() const;
1678  /** Returns the next valid UID for a bionic installation **/
1679  bionic_uid generate_bionic_uid() const;
1680  /** Returns true if the player has the entered bionic id */
1681  bool has_bionic( const bionic_id &b ) const;
1682  /** Returns true if the player has the entered bionic id and it is powered on */
1683  bool has_active_bionic( const bionic_id &b ) const;
1684  /**Returns true if the player has any bionic*/
1685  bool has_any_bionic() const;
1686  /**Return bionic_id of bionics able to use it as fuel*/
1687  std::vector<bionic_id> get_bionic_fueled_with_muscle() const;
1688  /**Return bionic_id of fueled bionics*/
1689  std::vector<bionic_id> get_fueled_bionics() const;
1690  /**Returns bionic_id of first remote fueled bionic found*/
1691  bionic_id get_remote_fueled_bionic() const;
1692 
1693  /**Return list of available fuel sources that are not empty for this bionic*/
1694  std::vector<item *> get_bionic_fuels( const bionic_id &bio );
1695  /** Returns not-empty UPS connected to cable charger bionic */
1696  std::vector<item *> get_cable_ups();
1697  /** Returns solar items connected to cable charger bionic */
1698  std::vector<item *> get_cable_solar();
1699  /** Returns vehicles connected to cable charger bionic */
1700  std::vector<vehicle *> get_cable_vehicle() const;
1701

1706  bool is_using_bionic_weapon() const;
1707  bionic_uid get_weapon_bionic_uid() const;

1710  void process_bionic( bionic &bio );

1712  * returns either success or failure with log message */
1713  ret_val<void> can_deactivate_bionic( bionic &bio, bool eff_only = false ) const;

1715  * deactivated */
1716  bool deactivate_bionic( bionic &bio, bool eff_only = false );

1718  void force_bionic_deactivation( bionic &bio );

1720  int num_bionics() const;
1721  /** Returns the bionic at a given index in my_bionics[] */
1722  bionic &bionic_at_index( int i );

1724  void clear_bionics();

1737  void introduce_into_anesthesia( const time_duration &duration, Character &installer,
1738  bool needs_anesthesia );

1740  std::optional<bionic *> find_bionic_by_type( const bionic_id &b ) const;

1742  std::optional<bionic *> find_bionic_by_uid( bionic_uid bio_uid ) const;

1744  void remove_bionic( const bionic &bio );

1746  bionic_uid add_bionic( const bionic_id &b, bionic_uid parent_uid = 0, bool suppress_debug = false );

1748  float env_surgery_bonus( int radius ) const;

1750  float bionics_adjusted_skill( bool autodoc, int skill_level = -1 ) const;
1751  /** Calculate non adjusted skill for (un)installing bionics */
1752  int bionics_pl_skill( bool autodoc, int skill_level = -1 ) const;
1753  /**Is the installation possible*/
1754  bool can_install_bionics( const itype &type, Character &installer, bool autodoc = false,
1755  int skill_level = -1 ) const;

1757  ret_val<void> is_installable( const item *it, bool by_autodoc ) const;

1760  bool install_bionics( const itype &type, Character &installer, bool autodoc = false,
1761  int skill_level = -1 );
1762  /**Success or failure of installation happens here*/
1763  void perform_install( const bionic_id &bid, bionic_uid upbio_uid, int difficulty, int success,
1764  int pl_skill, const std::string &installer_name,
1765  const std::vector<trait_id> &trait_to_rem, const tripoint &patient_pos );
1766  void bionics_install_failure( const bionic_id &bid, const std::string &installer, int difficulty,
1767  int success, float adjusted_skill, const tripoint &patient_pos );
1768  /**
1769  * Try to wield a contained item consuming moves proportional to weapon skill and volume.
1770  * @param container Container containing the item to be wielded
1771  * @param internal_item reference to contained item to wield.
1772  * @param penalties Whether item volume and temporary effects (e.g. GRABBED, DOWNED) should be considered.
1773  * @param base_cost Cost due to storage type.
1774  */
1775  bool wield_contents( item &container, item *internal_item = nullptr, bool penalties = true,
1776  int base_cost = INVENTORY_HANDLING_PENALTY );
1777  /** Uses a tool */
1778  void use( int inventory_position );
1779  /** Uses a tool at location */
1780  void use( item_location loc, int pre_obtain_moves = -1, std::string const &method = {} );
1781  /** Uses the current wielded weapon */
1782  void use_wielded();
1783  /** Wear item; returns false on fail. If interactive is false, don't alert the player or drain moves on completion. */
1784  std::optional<std::list<item>::iterator>
1785  wear( int pos, bool interactive = true );
1786 
1787  /** Wear item; returns false on fail. If interactive is false, don't alert the player or drain moves on completion.
1788  * @param item_wear item_location of item to be worn.
1789  * @param interactive Alert player and drain moves if true.
1790  */
1791  std::optional<std::list<item>::iterator>
1792  wear( item_location item_wear, bool interactive = true );
1793 
1794  /** Used for eating object at a location. Removes item if all of it was consumed.
1795  * @returns trinary enum NONE, SOME or ALL amount consumed.
1796  */
1797  trinary consume( item_location loc, bool force = false );
1798 
1799  /** Used for eating a particular item that doesn't need to be in inventory.
1800  * @returns trinary enum NONE, SOME or ALL (doesn't remove).
1801  */
1802  trinary consume( item &target, bool force = false );
1803 
1804  /**
1805  * Stores an item inside another consuming moves proportional to weapon skill and volume.
1806  * Note: This method bypasses pocket settings.
1807  * @param container Container in which to store the item
1808  * @param put Item to add to the container
1809  * @param penalties Whether item volume and temporary effects (e.g. GRABBED, DOWNED) should be considered.
1810  * @param base_cost Cost due to storage type.
1811  */
1812  void store( item &container, item &put, bool penalties = true,
1813  int base_cost = INVENTORY_HANDLING_PENALTY,
1814  pocket_type pk_type = pocket_type::CONTAINER,
1815  bool check_best_pkt = false );
1816  void store( item_pocket *pocket, item &put, bool penalties = true,
1817  int base_cost = INVENTORY_HANDLING_PENALTY );

1820  int skill_level = -1 ) const;

1823  int skill_level = -1 );

1826  /**When a player fails the surgery*/
1827  void bionics_uninstall_failure( int difficulty, int success, float adjusted_skill );

1894  // --------------- Generic Item Stuff ---------------
1895 
1896  struct has_mission_item_filter {
1897  int mission_id;
1898  bool operator()( const item &it ) const {
1899  return it.mission_id == mission_id || it.has_any_with( [&]( const item & it ) {
1900  return it.mission_id == mission_id;
1901  }, pocket_type::SOFTWARE );
1902  }
1903  };
1904 
1905  // -2 position is 0 worn index, -3 position is 1 worn index, etc
1906  static int worn_position_to_index( int position ) {
1907  return -2 - position;
1908  }
1909 
1910  // checks to see if an item is worn
1911  bool is_worn( const item &thing ) const {
1912  return worn.is_worn( thing );
1913  }
1914 
1915  bool is_worn_module( const item &thing ) const {
1916  return worn.is_worn_module( thing );
1917  }
1918  /**
1919  * Asks how to use the item (if it has more than one use_method) and uses it.
1920  * Returns true if it destroys the item. Consumes charges from the item.
1921  * Multi-use items are ONLY supported when all use_methods are iuse_actor!
1922  */
1923  virtual bool invoke_item( item *, const tripoint &pt, int pre_obtain_moves = -1 );
1924  /** As above, but with a pre-selected method. Debugmsg if this item doesn't have this method. */
1925  virtual bool invoke_item( item *, const std::string &, const tripoint &pt,
1926  int pre_obtain_moves = -1 );
1927  /** As above two, but with position equal to current position */
1928  virtual bool invoke_item( item * );
1929  virtual bool invoke_item( item *, const std::string & );
1930 
1931  /**
1932  * Drop, wear, stash or otherwise try to dispose of an item consuming appropriate moves
1933  * @param obj item to dispose of
1934  * @param prompt optional message to display in any menu
1935  * @return whether the item was successfully disposed of
1936  */
1937  virtual bool dispose_item( item_location &&obj, const std::string &prompt = std::string() );
1938 
1939  /** Consume charges of a tool or comestible item, potentially destroying it in the process
1940  * @param used item consuming the charges
1941  * @param qty number of charges to consume which must be non-zero
1942  * @return true if item was destroyed */
1943  bool consume_charges( item &used, int qty );
1944  /**
1945  * Remove charges from a specific item.
1946  * The item must exist and it must be counted by charges.
1947  * @param it A pointer to the item, it *must* exist.
1948  * @param quantity The number of charges to remove, must not be larger than
1949  * the current charges of the item.
1950  * @return An item that contains the removed charges, it's effectively a
1951  * copy of the item with the proper charges.
1952  */
1953  item reduce_charges( item *it, int quantity );
1954 
1955  /**
1956  * Calculate (but do not deduct) the number of moves required when handling (e.g. storing, drawing etc.) an item
1957  * @param it Item to calculate handling cost for
1958  * @param penalties Whether item volume and temporary effects (e.g. GRABBED, DOWNED) should be considered.
1959  * @param base_cost Cost due to storage type.
1960  * @param charges_in_it the amount of charges to be handled (default is whole)
1961  * @param bulk_cost Calculate costs excluding overhead, such as when loading and unloading items in bulk (default is false)
1962  * @return cost in moves ranging from 0 to MAX_HANDLING_COST
1963  */
1964  int item_handling_cost( const item &it, bool penalties = true,
1965  int base_cost = INVENTORY_HANDLING_PENALTY, int charges_in_it = -1, bool bulk_cost = false ) const;
1966 
1967  /**
1968  * Calculate (but do not deduct) the number of moves required when storing an item in a container
1969  * @param it Item to calculate storage cost for
1970  * @param container Container to store item in
1971  * @param penalties Whether item volume and temporary effects (e.g. GRABBED, DOWNED) should be considered.
1972  * @param base_cost Cost due to storage type.
1973  * @return cost in moves ranging from 0 to MAX_HANDLING_COST
1974  */
1975  int item_store_cost( const item &it, const item &container, bool penalties = true,
1976  int base_cost = INVENTORY_HANDLING_PENALTY ) const;
1977 
1978  /**
1979  * Calculate (but do not deduct) the number of moves required when drawing a weapon from an holster or sheathe
1980  * @param it Item to calculate retrieve cost for
1981  * @param container Container where the item is
1982  * @param penalties Whether item volume and temporary effects (e.g. GRABBED, DOWNED) should be considered.
1983  * @param base_cost Cost due to storage type.
1984  * @return cost in moves ranging from 0 to MAX_HANDLING_COST
1985  */
1986  int item_retrieve_cost( const item &it, const item &container, bool penalties = true,
1987  int base_cost = INVENTORY_HANDLING_PENALTY ) const;
1988 
1989  /** Calculate (but do not deduct) the number of moves required to wear an item */
1990  int item_wear_cost( const item &it ) const;
1991 
1992  /** Wear item; returns nullopt on fail, or pointer to newly worn item on success.
1993  * If interactive is false, don't alert the player or drain moves on completion.
1994  * If do_calc_encumbrance is false, don't recalculate encumbrance, caller must call it eventually.
1995  */
1996  std::optional<std::list<item>::iterator>
1997  wear_item( const item &to_wear, bool interactive = true, bool do_calc_encumbrance = true );
1998 
1999  /** Returns the amount of item `type' that is currently worn */
2000  int amount_worn( const itype_id &id ) const;
2001 
2002  /** Returns the amount of software `type' that are in the inventory */
2003  int count_softwares( const itype_id &id );
2004 
2005  /** Returns nearby items which match the provided predicate */
2006  std::vector<item_location> nearby( const std::function<bool( const item *, const item * )> &func,
2007  int radius = 1 ) const;
2008 
2009  /**
2010  * Similar to @ref remove_items_with, but considers only worn items and not their
2011  * content (@ref item::contents is not checked).
2012  * If the filter function returns true, the item is removed.
2013  */
2014  std::list<item> remove_worn_items_with( const std::function<bool( item & )> &filter );
2015 
2016  void clear_worn();
2017 
2018  // returns a list of all item_location the character has, including items contained in other items.
2019  // only for CONTAINER pocket type; does not look for magazines
2020  std::vector<item_location> all_items_loc();
2021  // Returns list of all the top level item_location the character has. Includes worn items but excludes items held on hand.
2022  std::vector<item_location> top_items_loc();
2023  /** Return the item pointer of the item with given invlet, return nullptr if
2024  * the player does not have such an item with that invlet. Don't use this on npcs.
2025  * Only use the invlet in the user interface, otherwise always use the item position. */
2026  item *invlet_to_item( int invlet ) const;
2027 
2028  // Returns the item with a given inventory position.
2029  item &i_at( int position );
2030  const item &i_at( int position ) const;
2031  /**
2032  * Returns the item position (suitable for @ref i_at or similar) of a
2033  * specific item. Returns INT_MIN if the item is not found.
2034  * Note that this may lose some information, for example the returned position is the
2035  * same when the given item points to the container and when it points to the item inside
2036  * the container. All items that are part of the same stack have the same item position.
2037  */
2038  int get_item_position( const item *it ) const;
2039 
2040  /**
2041  * Returns a reference to the item which will be used to make attacks.
2042  * At the moment it's always @ref weapon or a reference to a null item.
2043  */
2044  /*@{*/
2045  item_location used_weapon() const;
2046  item_location used_weapon();
2047  /*@}*/
2048 
2049  /**
2050  * Adds the item to the character's worn items or wields it, or prompts if the Character cannot pick it up.
2051  * @original_inventory_item set if the item was already in the characters inventory (wielded, worn, in different pocket) and is being moved.
2052  * @avoid is the item to not put @it into
2053  */
2054  item_location i_add( item it, bool should_stack = true, const item *avoid = nullptr,
2055  const item *original_inventory_item = nullptr, bool allow_drop = true,
2056  bool allow_wield = true, bool ignore_pkt_settings = false );
2057  item_location i_add( item it, int &copies_remaining, bool should_stack = true,
2058  const item *avoid = nullptr,
2059  const item *original_inventory_item = nullptr, bool allow_drop = true,
2060  bool allow_wield = true, bool ignore_pkt_settings = false );
2061  /** tries to add to the character's inventory without a popup. returns nullptr if it fails. */
2062  item_location try_add( item it, const item *avoid = nullptr,
2063  const item *original_inventory_item = nullptr, bool allow_wield = true,
2064  bool ignore_pkt_settings = false );
2065  item_location try_add( item it, int &copies_remaining, const item *avoid = nullptr,
2066  const item *original_inventory_item = nullptr, bool allow_wield = true,
2067  bool ignore_pkt_settings = false );
2068 
2069  ret_val<item_location> i_add_or_fill( item &it, bool should_stack = true,
2070  const item *avoid = nullptr,
2071  const item *original_inventory_item = nullptr, bool allow_drop = true,
2072  bool allow_wield = true, bool ignore_pkt_settings = false );
2073 
2074  /**
2075  * Try to pour the given liquid into the given container/vehicle. The transferred charges are
2076  * removed from the liquid item. Check the charges of afterwards to see if anything has
2077  * been transferred at all.
2078  * The functions do not consume any move points.
2079  * @return Whether anything has been moved at all. `false` indicates the transfer is not
2080  * possible at all. `true` indicates at least some of the liquid has been moved.
2081  */
2082  /**@{*/
2083  bool pour_into( item_location &container, item &liquid, bool ignore_settings );
2084  bool pour_into( const vpart_reference &vp, item &liquid ) const;
2085  /**@}*/
2086 
2087  /**
2088  * Remove a specific item from player possession. The item is compared
2089  * by pointer. Contents of the item are removed as well.
2090  * @param it A pointer to the item to be removed. The item *must* exists
2091  * in the players possession (one can use @ref has_item to check for this).
2092  * @return A copy of the removed item.
2093  */
2094  item i_rem( const item *it );
2095  void i_rem_keep_contents( const item *it );
2096  /** Sets invlet and adds to inventory if possible, drops otherwise, returns true if either succeeded.
2097  * An optional qty can be provided (and will perform better than separate calls).
2098  * @original_inventory_item set if the item was already in the characters inventory (wielded, worn, in different pocket) and is being moved.
2099  */
2100  bool i_add_or_drop( item &it, int qty = 1, const item *avoid = nullptr,
2101  const item *original_inventory_item = nullptr );
2102 
2103  /** Drops items at player location
2104  * An optional qty can be provided (and will perform better than separate calls).
2105  */
2106  bool i_drop_at( item &it, int qty = 1 );
2107 
2108  /**
2109  * Check any already unsealed pockets in items pointed to by `containers`
2110  * and propagate the unsealed status through the container tree. In the
2111  * process the player may be asked to handle containers or spill contents,
2112  * so make sure all unsealed containers are passed to this function in a
2113  * single batch; items (not limited to the ones listed in `containers` and
2114  * their contents) may be invalidated or moved after a call to this function.
2115  *
2116  * @param containers Item locations pointing to containers. Item locations
2117  * in this vector can contain each other, but should always be valid
2118  * (i.e. if A contains B and B contains C, A and C can be in the vector
2119  * at the same time and should be valid, but B shouldn't be invalidated
2120  * either, otherwise C is invalidated). Item location in this vector
2121  * should be unique.
2122  */
2123  void handle_contents_changed( const std::vector<item_location> &containers );
2124 
2125  /** Only use for UI things. Returns all invlets that are currently used in
2126  * the player inventory, the weapon slot and the worn items. */
2127  std::bitset<std::numeric_limits<char>::max()> allocated_invlets() const;
2128 
2129  /**
2130  * Whether the player carries an active item of the given item type.
2131  */
2132  bool has_active_item( const itype_id &id ) const;
2133  item remove_weapon();
2134  void remove_mission_items( int mission_id );
2135 
2136  /**
2137  * Returns the items that are ammo and have the matching ammo type.
2138  */
2139  std::vector<const item *> get_ammo( const ammotype &at ) const;
2140 
2141  /**
2142  * Searches for ammo or magazines that can be used to reload obj
2143  * @param obj item to be reloaded. By design any currently loaded ammunition or magazine is ignored
2144  * @param empty whether empty magazines should be considered as possible ammo
2145  * @param radius adjacent map/vehicle tiles to search. 0 for only player tile, -1 for only inventory
2146  */
2147  std::vector<item_location> find_ammo( const item &obj, bool empty = true, int radius = 1 ) const;
2148 
2149  /**
2150  * Searches for weapons and magazines that can be reloaded.
2151  */
2152  std::vector<item_location> find_reloadables();
2153  /**
2154  * Counts ammo and UPS charges (lower of) for a given gun on the character.
2155  */
2156  int ammo_count_for( const item_location &gun ) const;
2157 
2158  /**
2159  * Whether a tool or gun is potentially reloadable (optionally considering a specific ammo)
2160  * @param it Thing to be reloaded
2161  * @param ammo if set also check item currently compatible with this specific ammo or magazine
2162  * @note items currently loaded with a detachable magazine are considered reloadable
2163  * @note items with integral magazines are reloadable if free capacity permits (+/- ammo matches)
2164  */
2165  bool can_reload( const item &it, const item *ammo = nullptr ) const;
2166 
2167  /** Same as `Character::can_reload`, but checks for attached gunmods as well. */
2168  hint_rating rate_action_reload( const item &it ) const;
2169  /** Whether a tool or a gun can be unloaded. */
2170  hint_rating rate_action_unload( const item &it ) const;
2171  hint_rating rate_action_insert( const item_location &loc ) const;
2172  /**
2173  * So far only called by unload() from game.cpp
2174  * @avoid - do not put @it into @avoid
2175  * @original_inventory_item set if the item was already in the characters inventory (wielded, worn, in different pocket) and is being moved.
2176  */
2177  bool add_or_drop_with_msg( item &it, bool unloading = false, const item *avoid = nullptr,
2178  const item *original_inventory_item = nullptr );
2179  /**
2180  * Unload item.
2181  * @param bypass_activity If item requires an activity for its unloading, unload item immediately instead.
2182  */
2183  bool unload( item_location &loc, bool bypass_activity = false,
2184  const item_location &new_container = item_location::nowhere );
2185  /**
2186  * Calculate (but do not deduct) the number of moves required to reload an item with specified quantity of ammo
2187  * @param it Item to calculate reload cost for
2188  * @param ammo either ammo or magazine to use when reloading the item
2189  * @param qty maximum units of ammo to reload. Capped by remaining capacity and ignored if reloading using a magazine.
2190  */
2191  int item_reload_cost( const item &it, const item &ammo, int qty ) const;
2192 
2193  projectile thrown_item_projectile( const item &thrown ) const;
2194  int thrown_item_adjusted_damage( const item &thrown ) const;
2195  // calculates the total damage possible from a thrown item, without resistances and such.
2196  int thrown_item_total_damage_raw( const item &thrown ) const;
2197  /** Maximum thrown range with a given item, taking all active effects into account. */
2198  int throw_range( const item & ) const;
2199  /** Dispersion of a thrown item, against a given target, taking into account whether or not the throw was blind. */
2200  int throwing_dispersion( const item &to_throw, Creature *critter = nullptr,
2201  bool is_blind_throw = false ) const;
2202  /** How much dispersion does one point of target's dodge add when throwing at said target? */
2203  int throw_dispersion_per_dodge( bool add_encumbrance = true ) const;
2204 
2205  /** True if unarmed */
2206  bool unarmed_attack() const;

2209  /// returning the largest weight liftable by an item in range.
2210  units::mass best_nearby_lifting_assist() const;

2212  /// used for operations on distant objects (e.g. vehicle installation/uninstallation)
2213  units::mass best_nearby_lifting_assist( const tripoint &world_pos ) const;

2219  units::volume volume_carried() const;
2220 
2221  units::length max_single_item_length() const;
2222  units::volume max_single_item_volume() const;
2223 
2224  /// Sometimes we need to calculate hypothetical volume or weight. This
2225  /// struct offers two possible tweaks: a collection of items and
2226  /// counts to remove, or an entire replacement inventory.
2227  struct item_tweaks {
2228  item_tweaks() : without_items( std::nullopt ), replace_inv( std::nullopt ) {}
2229  explicit item_tweaks( const std::map<const item *, int> &w ) :
2230  without_items( std::cref( w ) )
2231  {}
2232  explicit item_tweaks( const inventory &r ) :
2233  replace_inv( std::cref( r ) )
2234  {}
2235  const std::optional<std::reference_wrapper<const std::map<const item *, int>>> without_items;
2236  const std::optional<std::reference_wrapper<const inventory>> replace_inv;
2237  };
2238 
2239  units::mass weight_carried_with_tweaks( const item_tweaks &tweaks ) const;
2240  units::mass weight_carried_with_tweaks( const std::vector<std::pair<item_location, int>>
2241  &locations ) const;
2242  units::volume volume_carried_with_tweaks( const item_tweaks &tweaks ) const;
2243  units::volume volume_carried_with_tweaks( const std::vector<std::pair<item_location, int>>
2244  &locations ) const;
2245  units::mass weight_capacity() const override;
2246  units::volume volume_capacity() const;
2247  units::volume volume_capacity_with_tweaks( const item_tweaks &tweaks ) const;
2248  units::volume volume_capacity_with_tweaks( const std::vector<std::pair<item_location, int>>
2249  &locations ) const;
2250  units::volume free_space() const;
2251  units::mass free_weight_capacity() const;

2253  * Returns the total volume of all worn holsters.
2254  */

2304  * @returns pocket_data_with_parent vector to return.

2479  void set_time_died( const time_point &time ) {
2480  if( time_died != calendar::before_time_starts ) {
2481  time_died = time;
2482  }

2506  * who can read and can read the fastest

2540  /**
2541  * It is supposed to hide the query_yn to simplify player vs. npc code.
2542  */
2543  template<typename ...Args>
2544  bool query_yn( const char *const msg, Args &&... args ) const {
2545  return query_yn( string_format( msg, std::forward<Args>( args ) ... ) );
2546  }
2547  virtual bool query_yn( const std::string &msg ) const = 0;

2570  *
2571  * This function checks whether a given body part cannot be damaged by a given
2572  * damage_unit. Note that this refers only to reduction of hp on that part. It
2573  * does not account for clothing damage, pain, status effects, etc.
2574  *
2575  * @param bp: Body part to perform the check on
2576  * @param dam: Type of damage to check for
2577  * @returns true if given damage can not reduce hp of given body part
2578  */

2651  void toggle_trait_deps( const trait_id &tr, const std::string &variant = "" );
2652  /**
2653  * Adds mandatory scenario and profession traits unless you already have them
2654  * And if you do already have them, refunds the points for the trait
2655  */
2656  void add_traits();
2657  /** Returns true if the player has crossed a mutation threshold
2658  * Player can only cross one mutation threshold.
2659  */
2660  bool crossed_threshold() const;
2661  /** Returns the category that the player has crossed the threshold of, if they have one
2662  */
2663  mutation_category_id get_threshold_category() const;
2664 
2665  void environmental_revert_effect();
2666 
2667  /**
2668  * Checks both the neighborhoods of from and to for climbable surfaces,
2669  * returns move cost of climbing from `from` to `to`.
2670  * 0 means climbing is not possible.
2671  * Return value can depend on the orientation of the terrain.
2672  */
2673  int climbing_cost( const tripoint &from, const tripoint &to ) const;

2745  int get_focus() const {
2746  return std::max( 1, focus_pool / 1000 );
2747  }
2748  void mod_focus( int amount ) {
2749  focus_pool += amount * 1000;
2750  focus_pool = std::max( focus_pool, 0 );
2751  }
2752  // Set the focus pool directly, only use for debugging.
2753  void set_focus( int amount ) {
2754  focus_pool = amount * 1000;
2755  }
2756  protected:
2757  int focus_pool = 0;
2758  std::set<mtype_id> known_monsters;
2759  public:
2760  int cash = 0;

2806  // Hauling items on the ground
2807  void toggle_hauling();

2809  void stop_hauling();

2812  void start_autohaul();
2813  void stop_autohaul();
2814  bool is_autohauling() const;
2815  // Remove items from haul list which are not in valid_items. Returns true if anything was trimmed
2816  bool trim_haul_list( const std::vector<item_location> &valid_items );
2817 
2818  /**
2819  * @brief Applies a lambda function on all items with the given flag and/or that pass the given boolean item function, using or creating caches from @ref inv_search_caches.
2820  * @param type Only process on items of this item type.
2821  * @param type_flag Only process on items whose type has this flag.
2822  * @param key A string to use as the key in the cache. Should usually be the same name as filter_func.
2823  * @param filter_func Only process on items that return true with this boolean item function. This is cached, so avoid using functions with varying results.
2824  * @param do_func A lambda function to apply on all items that pass the filters.
2825  */
2826  void cache_visit_items_with( const itype_id &type,
2827  const std::function<void( item & )> &do_func );
2828  void cache_visit_items_with( const flag_id &type_flag,
2829  const std::function<void( item & )> &do_func );
2830  void cache_visit_items_with( const std::string &key, bool( item::*filter_func )() const,
2831  const std::function<void( item & )> &do_func );
2832  void cache_visit_items_with( const std::string &key, const itype_id &type,
2833  const flag_id &type_flag, bool( item::*filter_func )() const,
2834  const std::function<void( item & )> &do_func );
2835  void cache_visit_items_with( const itype_id &type,
2836  const std::function<void( const item & )> &do_func ) const;
2837  void cache_visit_items_with( const flag_id &type_flag,
2838  const std::function<void( const item & )> &do_func ) const;
2839  void cache_visit_items_with( const std::string &key, bool( item::*filter_func )() const,
2840  const std::function<void( const item & )> &do_func ) const;
2841  void cache_visit_items_with( const std::string &key, const itype_id &type,
2842  const flag_id &type_flag, bool( item::*filter_func )() const,
2843  const std::function<void( const item & )> &do_func ) const;
2844  /**
2845  * @brief Returns true if the character has an item with given flag and/or that passes the given boolean item function, using or creating caches from @ref inv_search_caches.
2846  * @brief If you want to iterate over the entire cache, `cache_visit_items_with` should be used instead, as it's more optimized for processing entire caches.
2847  * @param type Look for items of this item type.
2848  * @param type_flag Look for items whose type has this flag.
2849  * @param key A string to use as the cache's key. Should usually be the same name as filter_func. Unneeded if checking only for a flag.
2850  * @param filter_func Look for items that return true with this boolean item function.
2851  * @param check_func An optional lambda function applied to items that pass the flag/bool function filters.
2852  * If it returns true, abort iteration and make cache_has_item_with return true. These results are not cached, unlike filter_func.
2853  * @return True if the character has an item that passes the criteria, including check_func if provided.
2854  */
2855  bool cache_has_item_with( const itype_id &type,
2856  const std::function<bool( const item & )> &check_func = return_true<item> ) const;
2857  bool cache_has_item_with( const flag_id &type_flag,
2858  const std::function<bool( const item & )> &check_func = return_true<item> ) const;
2859  bool cache_has_item_with( const std::string &key, bool( item::*filter_func )() const,
2860  const std::function<bool( const item & )> &check_func = return_true<item> ) const;
2861  bool cache_has_item_with( const std::string &key, const itype_id &type, const flag_id &type_flag,
2862  bool( item::*filter_func )() const,
2863  const std::function<bool( const item & )> &check_func = return_true<item> ) const;
2864  /**
2865  * @brief Find if the character has an item with a specific flag. Can also checks for charges, if needed.
2866  */
2867  bool has_item_with_flag( const flag_id &flag, bool need_charges = false ) const;
2868  /**
2869  * @brief Find if the character has an item whose type has a specific flag. Can also checks for charges, if needed. Uses or creates caches from @ref inv_search_caches.
2870  */
2871  bool cache_has_item_with_flag( const flag_id &type_flag, bool need_charges = false ) const;
2872  /**
2873  * @brief Returns all items with the given flag and/or that pass the given boolean item function, using or creating caches from @ref inv_search_caches.
2874  * @param type Only get items of this item type.
2875  * @param type_flag Only get items whose type has this flag.
2876  * @param key A string to use as the cache's key. Should usually be the same name as filter_func. Unneeded if checking only for a flag.
2877  * @param filter_func Only get items that return true with this boolean item function.
2878  * @param do_and_check_func An optional lambda function applied to items that pass the flag/bool function filters.
2879  * If it returns true, the item is added to the return vector. These results are not cached, unlike filter_func.
2880  * @return A vector of pointers to all items that pass the criteria.
2881  */
2882  std::vector<item *> cache_get_items_with( const itype_id &type,
2883  const std::function<bool( item & )> &do_and_check_func = return_true<item> );
2884  std::vector<item *> cache_get_items_with( const flag_id &type_flag,
2885  const std::function<bool( item & )> &do_and_check_func = return_true<item> );
2886  std::vector<item *> cache_get_items_with( const std::string &key,
2887  bool( item::*filter_func )() const,
2888  const std::function<bool( item & )> &do_and_check_func = return_true<item> );
2889  std::vector<item *> cache_get_items_with( const std::string &key, const itype_id &type,
2890  const flag_id &type_flag, bool( item::*filter_func )() const,
2891  const std::function<bool( item & )> &do_and_check_func = return_true<item> );
2892  std::vector<const item *> cache_get_items_with( const itype_id &type,
2893  const std::function<bool( const item & )> &check_func = return_true<item> ) const;
2894  std::vector<const item *> cache_get_items_with( const flag_id &type_flag,
2895  const std::function<bool( const item & )> &check_func = return_true<item> ) const;
2896  std::vector<const item *> cache_get_items_with( const std::string &key,
2897  bool( item::*filter_func )() const,
2898  const std::function<bool( const item & )> &check_func = return_true<item> ) const;
2899  std::vector<const item *> cache_get_items_with( const std::string &key, const itype_id &type,
2900  const flag_id &type_flag, bool( item::*filter_func )() const,
2901  const std::function<bool( const item & )> &check_func = return_true<item> ) const;
2902  /**
2903  * Add an item to existing @ref inv_search_caches that it meets the criteria for. Will NOT create any new caches.
2904  */
2905  void add_to_inv_search_caches( item &it ) const;
2906 
2907  bool has_charges( const itype_id &it, int quantity,
2908  const std::function<bool( const item & )> &filter = return_true<item> ) const override;

3117  /**
3118  * Fires a gun or auxiliary gunmod (ignoring any current mode)
3119  * @param target where the first shot is aimed at (may vary for later shots)
3120  * @param shots maximum number of shots to fire (less may be fired in some circumstances)
3121  * @return number of shots actually fired
3122  */
3123 
3124  int fire_gun( const tripoint &target, int shots = 1 );
3125  /**
3126  * Fires a gun or auxiliary gunmod (ignoring any current mode)
3127  * @param target where the first shot is aimed at (may vary for later shots)
3128  * @param shots maximum number of shots to fire (less may be fired in some circumstances)
3129  * @param gun item to fire (which does not necessary have to be in the players possession)
3130  * @return number of shots actually fired
3131  */

3135  const std::optional<tripoint> &blind_throw_from_pos = std::nullopt );

3137  protected:

3139  const damage_type_id &dt, const bodypart_id &bp ) override;
3140  public:

3143  /** Called when an item is taken off */

3300  /**
3301  * @brief Check current level of a vitamin
3302  *
3303  * @details Accesses level of a given vitamin. If the vitamin_id specified does not
3304  * exist then this function simply returns 0.
3305  *
3306  * @param vit ID of vitamin to check level for (ie "vitC", "iron").
3307  * @returns character's current level for specified vitamin
3308  */
3309  int vitamin_get( const vitamin_id &vit ) const;
3310  // same as above, if actual = true get real daily intake, otherwise get speculated daily intake
3311  int get_daily_vitamin( const vitamin_id &vit, bool actual = true ) const;
3312  /**
3313  * Sets level of a vitamin
3314  *
3315  * @note status effects are still set for deficiency/excess
3316  *
3317  * @param[in] vit ID of vitamin to adjust quantity for
3318  * @param[in] qty Quantity to set level to
3319  */
3320  void vitamin_set( const vitamin_id &vit, int qty );
3321  /**
3322  * Add or subtract vitamins from character storage pools
3323  * @param vit ID of vitamin to modify
3324  * @param qty amount by which to adjust vitamin (negative values are permitted)
3325  * @return adjusted level for the vitamin or zero if vitamin does not exist
3326  */
3327  int vitamin_mod( const vitamin_id &vit, int qty );
3328  void vitamins_mod( const std::map<vitamin_id, int> & );

3543  * The player is not required to have enough tool charges to finish crafting, only to
3544  * complete the first step (total / 20 + total % 20 charges)

3565 
3566  struct craft_roll_data {
3567  float center;
3568  float stddev;
3569  float final_difficulty;
3570  };
3571  /**
3572  * Calculate a value representing the success of the player at crafting the given recipe,
3573  * taking player skill, recipe difficulty, npc helpers, and player mutations into account.
3574  * @param making the recipe for which to calculate
3575  * @return a value >= 0.0 with >= 1.0 representing unequivocal success
3576  */
3577  float crafting_success_roll( const recipe &making ) const;
3578  float crafting_failure_roll( const recipe &making ) const;
3579  float get_recipe_weighted_skill_average( const recipe &making ) const;
3580  float recipe_success_chance( const recipe &making ) const;
3581  float item_destruction_chance( const recipe &making ) const;
3582  craft_roll_data recipe_success_roll_data( const recipe &making ) const;
3583  craft_roll_data recipe_failure_roll_data( const recipe &making ) const;
3584  void complete_craft( item &craft, const std::optional<tripoint> &loc );
3585  /**
3586  * Check if the player meets the requirements to continue the in progress craft and if
3587  * unable to continue print messages explaining the reason.
3588  * If the craft is missing components due to messing up, prompt to consume new ones to
3589  * allow the craft to be continued.
3590  * @param craft the currently in progress craft
3591  * @return if the craft can be continued
3592  */
3593  bool can_continue_craft( item &craft );
3594  bool can_continue_craft( item &craft, const requirement_data &continue_reqs );
3595  /** Return nearby Characters ready and willing to help with crafting. */
3596  std::vector<Character *> get_crafting_helpers() const;
3597  /**
3598  * Return group of ally characters sharing knowledge of crafting.
3599  * Unlike get_crafting_helpers, includes the caller and sleeping Characters.
3600  */
3601  std::vector<Character *> get_crafting_group() const;
3602  int get_num_crafting_helpers( int max ) const;
3603  /**
3604  * Handle skill gain for player and followers during crafting.
3605  * Returns true if character leveled up.
3606  * @param craft the currently in progress craft
3607  * @param num_practice_ticks to trigger. This is used to apply
3608  * multiple steps of incremental skill gain simultaneously if needed.
3609  */
3610  bool craft_skill_gain( const item &craft, const int &num_practice_ticks );
3611  /**
3612  * Handle proficiency practice for player and followers while crafting. Returns
3613  * true if a proficiency is acquired.
3614  * @param craft - the in progress craft
3615  * @param time - the amount of time since the last practice tick
3616  */
3617  bool craft_proficiency_gain( const item &craft, const time_duration &time );
3618  /**
3619  * Check if the player can disassemble an item using the current crafting inventory
3620  * @param obj Object to check for disassembly
3621  * @param inv current crafting inventory
3622  */
3623  ret_val<void> can_disassemble( const item &obj, const read_only_visitable &inv ) const;
3624  item_location create_in_progress_disassembly( item_location target );
3625 
3626  bool disassemble();

3829  struct trait_data {
3830  /** Whether the mutation is activated. */
3831  bool powered = false;
3832  /** Key to select the mutation in the UI. */
3833  char key = ' ';
3834  /**
3835  * Time (in turns) until the mutation increase hunger/thirst/sleepiness according
3836  * to its cost (@ref mutation_branch::cost). When those costs have been paid, this
3837  * is reset to @ref mutation_branch::cooldown.
3838  */
3839  time_duration charge = 0_turns;
3840 
3841  bool show_sprite = true;
3842 
3843  /** A trait variant if it has one, or nullptr */
3844  const mutation_variant *variant = nullptr;
3845 
3846  void serialize( JsonOut &json ) const;
3847  void deserialize( const JsonObject &data );

3849  trait_data() = default;
3850  explicit trait_data( const mutation_variant *chosen ) : variant( chosen ) {}
3851  };

3905  * Traits / mutations of the character. Key is the mutation id (it's also a valid
3906  * key into @ref mutation_data), the value describes the status of the mutation.
3907  * If there is not entry for a mutation, the character does not have it. If the map
3908  * contains the entry, the character has the mutation.
3909  */
